wjim1269

Violence makes sports fun, whether you're playing or watching. The purpose of sports is to be agressive in order to win. If you're playing worried about being penalized for violence, the game gets boring.
 
 And before someone mentions it, injuries are part of athletics. If you don't want to be injured, don't play the game.
Debater

 If a guy seriously hurt the other guy on purpose then that is the crime of battery and assault.
Crim

Not if it's within the rules.
 For instance, Warren Sapp's cut block last year of Chad Clifton.

yes of course
 
 I meant one in violation of the rules.

Still.
 Offensive linemen who use illegal cut blocks to take out defender's legs usually get fined or suspended. They don't get arrested.

yes and they shouldn't be arrested.
